title: Zinedine Zidane enters 'must-win' territory as Jose Mourinho edges closer to Real Madrid return
text:

Zinedine Zidane is reportedly on thin ice at Real Madrid amid rumours that Jose Mourinho is in line for a shock return to the club.

The Frenchman has found his second managerial tenure at the club difficult, as he struggles to recapture the form that won him and his side three Champions League titles in four years.

Madrid suffered a 1-0 defeat at the hands of Real Mallorca on Saturday which caused them to fall behind rivals Barcelona in the table, and Zidane is now said to be in 'must-win territory'.

Goal report that some of Madrid's board members have lost trust in Zidane, and are growing increasingly impatient.

They cite the 3-0 loss to PSG in the Champions League last month, and the 7-3 defeat to neighbours Atletico Madrid in the summer as examples and reasons for their lack of faith.

(Image: REUTERS)

Zidane's previous image has now been tarnished with the board, who expect nothing less than a win against Galatasary on Tuesday, and even that would give the 47-year-old little breathing space.

Certain board members feel re-appointing Zidane was a mistake after he called time on his reign just nine-and-a-half months prior.

Some of his signings have failed to hit the ground running after he splashed over £250 million in the summer, with Madrid fans yet to see the best of the likes of Luka Jovic and Eden Hazard.

Furthermore, sections of the board feel a managerial change could bring about a fresh start and increase Madrid's chances of competing for major honours.

(Image: SkySports)

Mourinho is one of few managers who have left the Santiago Bernabeu on good terms, and has teased an imminent return to the dugout.

The Portuguese coach spent three years at the club from 2010-2013, and has been out of work since his sacking by Man Utd in December.

He is believed to be considered as the ideal successor to Zidane should the Frenchman leave or be removed from his post.

Lyon president Jean-Michel Aulas recently claimed that Mourinho had already made a decision on his next club, fuelling more speculation that Zidane could get the chop anytime soon.

Aulas said: "We had some fairly flattering exchanges over SMS. It was nice for everyone.

"He did not accept our proposal to meet because he has already chosen another club."
description: Some Madrid board members are said to regret re-appointing Zidane and no longer trust him to bring success
